LanguageData.ZP_GinjoSake.label: Ginjo
LanguageData.ZP_GinjoSake.description: Sake made from fermenting White rice and grain. Ginjo differs from Junmai due to the inclusion of non-rice elements; moreover, the rice used for Ginjo is typically polished to only 60%, whereas Junmai's is polished to 70%.\nThough a bit generalized, Ginjo is known for its fruity taste and pleasant fragrance.
LanguageData.ZP_GinjoSake.tools.0.label: bottle
LanguageData.ZP_GinjoSake.tools.1.label: neck
